intro: Morisonia siliquosa, commonly known as the siliquous morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant produces elongated, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, preferring moist, sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation.
